In the Beast Wars Cartoon it was made to sound like Primus was one of the
ancient leaders.  Megatron and Optimus were reading from the Articles of
Primus in the last couple episodes.

Megatron wants the same thing every Tyrant wants, Peace through Tyranny- I
once did a paper on the subject (Based on Ghengis Khan) It means that fear
is the only way to maintain control and freedom is the catylist for lack of
control. Without freedom there is only one way to do things, the controllers
way. with only one choice  there is only order and as another transformer
tech spec says without order there can be only chaos. Kudos for anyone who
can tell me who's card that is (I can't remember.)

Yes I agree that Megatron wants peace
A little piece of Cybertron, a little piece of Earth, a little piece of
Nebulos, or Hydrus for what it's worth.

Decepticons aren't bad, they're just drawn that way.


----- Original Message -----
From: robertdahl <rdahl@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, June 07, 2001 7:15 PM
Subject: Re: A little spark...


> OOC: Well it's not that clean cut Alloran. In this version, which is
> Beast wars, and seems to be based on the cartoon of Transformers, there
> was no Primus. At least, not mentioned. They were all made as simple
> machines, to work as the Quintessons felt needed, but when the
> Quintessons made the mistake of giving them personalities, they
> rebelled. Also, it's not necessarily clean cut, I mean, sure the
> Decepticons act evil, but in their minds, they may be justified.
> Megatron's quote is "peace through tyranny." and by that, I think it
> implies he wants peace, but the universe isnt able to achieve it if they
> are free, as people tend to be greedy. This is just my opinion of
> course, and I think the Decepticons are pure evil (dont ask me why I
> like em that way, I havent the foggiest) but there isnt a rule book
> saying right or wrong. And they never stated clearly about this whole
> Matrix pit thing in the cartoon. That's just your take on it
> Legendarynemasis.
>
